diff_hunk:
@@ -4224,11 +4224,13 @@ def test_serialization(self):
         b += [(t1.storage(), t1.storage(), t2.storage())]
         b += [a[0].storage()[0:2]]
         for use_name in (False, True):
-            with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() as f:
-                handle = f if not use_name else f.name
-                torch.save(b, handle)
-                f.seek(0)
-                c = torch.load(handle)
+            f = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(delete=False)
body: So if you don’t use t as a context manager then the file doesn’t even get opened? It seems that it’s not the case since you’re sill calling close(), so I’m not sure what’s the problem.
body_html: So if you don’t use t as a context manager then the file doesn’t even get opened? It seems that it’s not the case since you’re sill calling close(), so I’m not sure what’s the problem.
